member.name: M:Rainbow.DesktopModules.Pictures.BindData(System.Int32)
member.summary: The Binddata method on this User Control is used to obtain a DataReader of picture information from the Pictures table, and then databind the results to a templated DataList server control. It uses the Rainbow.PictureDB() data component to encapsulate all data functionality.

member.name: T:Rainbow.DesktopModules.Pictures.ResizeOption
member.summary: Resize Options NoResize : Do not resize the picture FixedWidthHeight : Use the width and height specified. MaintainAspectWidth : Use the specified height and calculate height using the original aspect ratio MaintainAspectHeight : Use the specified width and calculate width using the original aspect ration

member.name: T:Rainbow.DesktopModules.PicturesEdit
member.summary: Rainbow Portal Pictures module - Edit page part (c)2002 by Ender Malkoc

member.name: M:Rainbow.DesktopModules.PicturesEdit.Page_Load(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
The Page_Load event on this Page is used to obtain the ModuleID and ItemID of the picture to edit.
It then uses the Rainbow.PicturesDB() data component to populate the page's edit controls with the picture details.

member.name: M:Rainbow.DesktopModules.PicturesEdit.OnUpdate(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: The UpdateBtn_Click event handler on this Page is used to either create or update a picture. It uses the Rainbow.PicturesDB() data component to encapsulate all data functionality.

member.name: M:Rainbow.DesktopModules.PicturesEdit.OnDelete(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: The DeleteBtn_Click event handler on this Page is used to delete a picture. It uses the Rainbow.PicturesDB() data component to encapsulate all data functionality.

member.name: M:Rainbow.DesktopModules.PictureView.Page_Load(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: The Page_Load event handler on this Page is used to obtain obtain the contents of a picture from the Pictures table, construct an HTTP Response of the correct type for the picture, and then stream the picture contents to the response. It uses the Rainbow.PictureDB() data component to encapsulate the data access functionality.
